"...oh? <%me>...": "What's the matter, Quna? Lost your nerve?"
"...I'm not in the mood. Next time."
"Looks like you granted her the perfect excuse to escape, <%me>."
"...keep running your lips, and I'll help you shut up... permanently."
"Haha, it's a joke. With Luther gone, I'm not in a hurry to die anymore."
"...explain."
"The Photoners are an ancient race. Even with their advanced technology, it would be impossible to maintain their original bodies from that era."
"The logical question, then, is where did Luther get his body from?"
"...the answer is right here. He slipped in and out of the bodies of ARKS."
"When his current body started to fail, he'd move on to the next... much like Dark Falz."
"Ah the irony... that he turned out to be a Dark Falz in the end."
"Are you, too, one of us? An artificial creation?"
"That's right. I'm one of the first Casra type clones, modeled after the late hero, from the early experiments."
"The reason we weren't mass produced like the Claris Claes type was, well... we're not very cooperative."
"The original Casra always had a rebellious streak to him, so Luther had to take direct control, or so I heard."
"Ah, but please don't misunderstand me. I'm not appealing to your sympathy just because we share a similar past."
"I was the one who devised the Biosynthetic Dragon Project. That makes me the rightful target of your revenge, Lady Quna."
"I am further responsible for failing to foresee Luther's actions, and thereby permitting those inhuman experiments, however indirectly."
"...Hero Casra. Why did you not conceal the intel regarding the man-made dragon?"
"Your M.O. is to secretly dispose of such data, and yet, when you were in control you leaked\u3000it all, including the classified experiments..."
"It's as if you intended to expose its dark secrets... why would you do such a thing?"
"Hmm, I don't know what came over me."
"...You really get on my nerves."
"Well then, it looks like I get to live another day."
"1. Was all of that really true?"
"2. Don't you think you went a little too far?"
"Who can say? I'll leave it up to your imagination to decide truth from fiction."
"You think so? But I was being fairly serious."
"But I suppose I may have said a bit much. For some reason, I loosen up around you.  It's a real problem."
"Now if you'll excuse me, I'd best be off before I blurt out something else I shouldn't. Cheers."
